page.title: 04Horton Priory Sellindge PAST
page.content: Horton Priory stands in its own grounds off Moorstock Lane about half a mile North of the main A20 road.It was featured in the original Domesday Book as being part of baronial lands given to Hugo de Montfort by William The Conqueror.Hugo's daughter married Robert de Vere who gave land for a Priory to be built for Cluniac Monks in 1144.The priory was a cell of the Church of St.Pancrace at Lewes in Sussex. The Priory flourished over the centuries until Henry VIII dissolved the monasteries.The last Prior,Richard Gloucester,alias Brisley,surrendered the priory to Henry who gave it to Archbishop Thomas of Canterbury and he in turn let it to Sir Richard Tate.During the next 400 years the building had various owners until 1912.
